alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 3:28AM PST until January 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW EARLY TODAY FOLLOWED BY MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TONIGHT NIGHT INTO THURSDAY... .A weak system will spread light to moderate snow across the Cascade crest and over southeast Washington into the southern to central Idaho Panhandle this morning. This is expected to result in a slippery drive for the Wednesday morning commute. A stronger and wetter storm system arrives tonight with moderate to heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible for much of eastern Washington and the Idaho Panhandle. Major disruptions to travel will be possible, including the Thursday morning commute. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches, with local amounts to 12 inches near the mountains. * WHERE...Eastport, Sandpoint, Colville, Northport, Bonners Ferry, Orin-Rice Road, Athol, Newport, Flowery Trail Road, Chewelah, Deer Park, Springdale-Hunters Road, Kettle Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Priest River. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
